alert.note: Alert for Morgan; Weld (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 16 at 11:44AM MDT until June 20 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory is extended for the following rivers in Colorado... South Platte River near Weldona affecting Weld and Morgan Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...South Platte River near Weldona. * WHEN...Until Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, The river is out of its banks and into fields and meadows. At 10.0 feet, There is widespread lowland and meadow flooding. Irrigation works are impacted. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM MDT Friday the stage was 7.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to decrease over the next 12 hours but then rise again above action stage Saturday. The river will continue to rise through early next week. Additional wide spread heavy rain today could bring the crest near flood stage by Monday. - Action stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
